#Text=Pick a Family Reunion Location
#Text=Choosing a location for a family reunion can difficult when each person has their mind set on a different meeting place .
#Text=Another challenge can be taking into account where everyone is traveling from to get to the reunion , and how much money you are willing to spend on the event .
#Text=By calculating a budget , considering local attractions , and calling for a family vote , you can initiate a fun and memorable family reunion .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Calculating Your Budget
#Text=Come up with a per-head expenditure .
#Text=This should include shared , group expenses rather than individual expenses .
#Text=Coming up with an idea of per-head spending will help you to set a budget that suits everyone .
#Text=This will help you to more easily choose a location that suits your needs .
#Text=Choose one family member , or elect a finance committee , to calculate these costs .
#Text=They will be responsible for budgeting and planning for expenses of the family reunion .
#Text=They will also collect monetary contributions from the rest of the family .
#Text=Costs to keep in mind include food , transportation , lodging , venue rentals , and means of entertainment .
#Text=Consider the cost of food when choosing location .
#Text=No family reunion is complete without a feast of some sort .
#Text=Whether you want to have a cook-out , order in , or go to a restaurant , you will have to account for the cost of food during your reunion .
#Text=Take transportation into account .
#Text=Some family members may be traveling from far locations for the reunion event .
#Text=Be considerate of their budgetary needs and financial situation .

#Text=If you are splitting the cost of the event between several families , first ask them for a range of what they would be willing to spend on the event altogether , including their own transportation costs .
#Text=Weigh lodging costs .
#Text=While you may want to stay at a nearby relative ’s house to cut back on costs , some families may want to stay in a hotel room or motel .
#Text=Use these costs to determine the best location for your reunion .
#Text=If you ’re looking for a cheaper option , you may want to consider a local campground , taking time of year and forecasted weather into account .
#Text=Many campgrounds provide excellent activities for children , such as fishing , pools , and paddle boat riding .
#Text=Factor in venue costs to narrow down options .
#Text=If you are renting a function or banquet hall for the reunion , there will be a fee .
#Text=Call ahead of time to ask about the cost for a per-day rental .
#Text=This will help eliminate some of the pricier location options .
#Text=Some venues offer additional options , such as decorations or a photographer that you can use during your event for an additional fee .
#Text=Budget for costs of entertainment at each location .
#Text=Whether you are choosing to bring games and activities with you or participate in nearby attractions , such as horse riding , these costs can add up .
#Text=Be sure to account for everything offered at each of your potential event locations .
#Text=Exploring Location Options
#Text=Choose family-appropriate venues as options .
#Text=Consider the ages of the youngest members of your extended family , and choose a location that would interest them as well .
#Text=While your uncle may think that a bar is a good place to meet , this location would n’t work for your cousin ’s five-year-old daughter , for example .
#Text=Age-appropriate venues can include a state park , a campground , a bowling alley , or a country club .
#Text=Look for locations that offer lodging .
#Text=If some members of your family are traveling far distances for the reunion , they will need somewhere to stay .
#Text=Be sure that you take each family member ’s needs and budget into account during this process .
#Text=Choose a lodging location that is within each family member ’s individual budget .
#Text=Also , be sure that the lodging is located a reasonable distance from the main event venue and any additional activities .
#Text=Nobody wants to spend the entire reunion driving from location to location .
#Text=Ask for recommendations from friends .
#Text=Local friends may have hosted their own family reunions , so do not hesitate to ask them for ideas .
#Text=Your friends may even have connections or know of ongoing discounts in your area .
#Text=Allow each family member to come up with a location .
#Text=If everyone gets a chance to offer their ideas , then they will feel more included in the planning process and will be more excited about the overall event .
#Text=Tell them to email you or call you with their ideas , and conduct a family vote once all have been collected .
#Text=Choosing a Reunion Venue
#Text=Give fair consideration to all suggested locations .
#Text=As it is a family reunion , it would be great if every suggested place by each member is considered at least once .
#Text=This will avoid conflicts later .
#Text=Check the amenities at each venue option .
#Text=Be sure that there are accessible restrooms for your family to use .
#Text=You may want to consider a venue with a kitchen if you intent to do some cooking at the event itself .
#Text=Ask whether the venue allows alcohol on its premises if you want to bring booze to your event .
#Text=If you have a disabled family member , check that the facility offers amenities for disabled people , such as a ramp and a wheelchair-accessible bathroom .
#Text=Go through the travelogues of the shortlisted places .
#Text=Check each place to see whether or not it has a minimum of two things of interest for each age group .
#Text=If you would rather book a place that does not offer its own attractions , come up with games or activities that you could bring to the event in order to keep everyone entertained .
#Text=Look for places that offer exciting things to do , such as boat rides or fishing .
#Text=If you plan on bringing your own activities , try to find a place that has plenty of space for you to set these games up , whether it 's a volleyball net or a water balloon toss .
#Text=Conduct a family vote to choose the location .
#Text=Have each family member email their selections to a chosen Vote Counter .
#Text=This vote will eliminate places that more than a few family members are disinterested in pursuing .
#Text=Make reservations early .
#Text=Venues can book up quickly , especially during the summer months , so be sure to call and make a reservation as soon as you can .
#Text=Ask about any cancellation fees or security deposits , so that you have all of your bases covered .
#Text=Video
